intro: Cirsium mamiyanum, commonly known as the Mamiyan thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the daisy family, Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries such as Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flower heads, which are typical of the Cirsium genus. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
